alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 10:11PM EST until January 26 at 6:06AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming affecting Forsyth County. For the Big Creek...including Cumming...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding will expand into the natural flood plain of the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at Atlanta Highway or Georgia Highway 9. Large portions of the sidewalk and boardwalk of the Big Creek Greenway will begin to flood. The areas under the Georgia 400 Highway and McFarland Road will be covered with around one foot of water. A portion of the sidewalk under Majors Road will be covered with around two feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 6.2 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 3 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 6 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 615 AM EST.
